result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Morgan John Hoglund

records.addlTxt:
9:31 AM Cases 22CF190, 22TR676, 22TR677 called together.  Defendant Morgan John Hoglund in court.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Morgan John Hoglund.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Case 22CF190 on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.
Status conference scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on December 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: 2:44 PM Called 22CF190 for PH and 22TR676 & 22TR677 for STC.  Defendant Morgan John Hoglund in court.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Morgan John Hoglund.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. All parties appear in person.  Case is on for preliminary hearing.  State calls first witness, WI DNR Conservation Warden Dustin Gabrielson, who is sworn in and testifies.  Witness has identified the defendant.  Venue is made. Attny Pollak cross examines Warden Gabrielson. State redirects.  Witness clarifies.  Attny Pollak redirects. No further questions.  Witness steps down.  No other witnesses today.  State presents paper document, print off from MN public access re: prior conviction, to Attny Pollak and to the Court to provide proof for 2nd offense.  Exhibit 1 marked and received into evidence.  No objection today.  No further witness or evidence today.  Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and the defendant probably committed it.  The matter is bound over for further proceedings.  The State files information. which mirrors the criminal complaint. Bond continues. Arraignment scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 09:15 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing
